Ivan Milecz über die Repressionen gegen Juden in der Bukowina im Jahr 1941

div.p: The original transcription is not available.

Based on different information, the Romanian offices are taking rough actions against the Jews in Bukovina. In Černovice, 50 Jews who have been working in leading positions were arrested and interned. The public in Černovice was informed about this step by posters hanging in the streets and where it is announced that the 50 Jews vouch with their lives and property for peace and order being kept by the rest of the Jewish population. If there is a slightest aggression against Romanian or allied forces pursued by the Jewish people, the interned Jews will be executed on the spot and their property will be confiscated. Anybody who pursues any aggression against Romanian, German or Italian commissioned officers, non-commissioned officers, soldiers or clerks is to be executed on the spot as well. The same punishment awaits all those who help to pursue this in any way. Police or army units all over Bukovina who do not follow this order of the deputy of General Antonescu, lieutenant Riosanu, are also to be punished by death.

The second decree of the governor of Bukovina, lieutenant Riosanu, specifies the rules for Jewish life on the streets. Jews are not allowed to move around the streets in groups of more than 3 people and they are allowed to move around the streets only from 6am until 8pm. All the shopping (except shopping for bread, which is being sold every day from 6am) is only allowed from 9:30 until 11:00. Any Jewish business signs on the shops are prohibited, prohibited are also any flags, including Romanian, Italian or German flag on the Jewish shops. The Jewish doctors, lawyers, engineers and other members of the free occupations must have a board with details of the profession and sign “Jew” placed at the entrance to the building where their profession is carried out. All the Jews, regardless of their age and sex, must wear a Star of David made from yellow cloth on the left side of their chests. The star must be placed in a way so it is clear and visible. Any breach of this decree will be punished by an immediate interning, regardless of any further legal sanctions.
There are 3 days given for preparing the signs and the Star of David. All the other points of this decree are effective immediately.
Made in 4 copies, 3 of them for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and 1 copy to be stored within the records.
